eventMetadata.deprecated_versions: events published with "aRN" as the response element

eventDescription.latestDescription:
This is a reminder that on January 26, 2024, AWS Secrets Manager will be deploying a change to the format of our AWS CloudTrail events that could impact any workload which consumes these events. We previously notified you about this upcoming change in August 2023. This change is being made to standardize the response element for secret ARN in AWS CloudTrail events for all AWS Secret Manager APIs. If you do not use AWS CloudTrail logs for AWS Secrets Manager, you can disregard this message.

Currently, the 10 CloudTrail events listed below are published with “aRN” as the response element while the rest of the events are published with “arn” as the response element. If you are consuming AWS Secrets Manager CloudTrail events in your workloads either directly or via Amazon EventBridge, we recommend you inspect your application code or event filters as soon as possible to determine if you are consuming any of these 10 events, and if so whether they require any updates to support both formats of the secret ARN response element (“arn” or “aRN”). This will ensure your workload is not impacted by this upcoming change.

Please refer to this link [1] for details on the change to the response element of AWS CloudTrail events for AWS Secrets Manager.

List of events that currently publish “aRN” and will be changed to “arn” starting January 2024:
CancelRotateSecret
DeleteResourcePolicy
DeleteSecret
PutResourcePolicy
RemoveRegionsFromReplication
ReplicateSecretToRegions
RestoreSecret
RotateSecret
StopReplicationToReplica
UpdateSecretVersionStage

List of events with no change:
CreateSecret
DescribeSecret
GetRandomPassword
GetResourcePolicy
GetSecretValue
ListSecrets
ListSecretVersionIds
PutSecretValue
TagResource
UntagResource
UpdateSecret
ValidateResourcePolicy

If you have any questions, please contact AWS Support [2].

[1] https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/secrets-manager-arn
[2] https://aws.amazon.com/support

Current severity level: Informational

Elevated Replication latency

[10:46 AM PDT] We are operating our replication subsystem at full throughput now so we can process RTC replication and backlog from the US-EAST-1 Region to different destinations. Customers needing to replicate or backup S3 data while we restore normal operations to the replication subsystem should use S3's COPY API, S3's Batch Operations using the COPY API, or AWS Backup. We will provide you with a further update by Oct 19 11:45 AM PDT.

The following AWS services have been affected by this event: RESOURCEEXPLORER (Informational).
